title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to redesignate provisions and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Amendments are made to subsections (b) and (c) of Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, regarding payments and effective dates. The amendments made by subsection (b) of Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months beginning on or after that date. SEC. 3. Rate of Payment of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Surviving Spouses of Certain Filipino Veterans. The rate of payment under section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include benefits under chapter 13 of this title. This amendment will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months after that date. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF CERTAIN FILIPINO VETERANS FOR DISABILITY PENSION. Amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, expands eligibility criteria by including additional subsections and chapters. The amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code expands eligibility criteria by including chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15. It also adjusts the rate of payment by adding a new subsection (e) for benefits under chapter 15 paid to individuals in the United States. The amendment expands eligibility criteria for benefits under title 38, United States Code. Benefits are adjusted based on residency, with different rates for individuals in the United States and the Republic of the Philippines. The effective date for these changes is upon enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38 to provide health care to Filipino veterans in the US. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient care for veterans in the Philippines. The Secretary shall provide outpatient care and services to World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts residing in the Philippines for their service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities. The Secretary provides outpatient care to veterans and scouts in the Philippines for disabilities, with a limit of $500,000 per fiscal year. Chapter 17 of the title is amended by adding new items after section 1734. The amendments made by this section regarding outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines will take effect on the enactment date of this Act.
